title: (x) Slab serif in Haggar ads by Crispin-Porter-Bogusky - FF Absara {Mark Foster}
content:
Searched and searched, no luck. Any help greatly appreciated. I have a few other examples from the same campaign if needed.

author: dujnoyl

comments.content: Mark’s got it. What is the campaign, Judd? Would love to add more examples of new FontFonts in use.

Ding, ding, ding, we have a winner!! Thanks.

As for the campaign, it’s from a Haggar campaign from Crispin-Porter-Bogusky. I saw it in the latest Luerzers Int’l Archive and was digging it.

Here’s the scan from the mag. :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155320im_/http:/typophile.com/files/campaign_5397.jpg)
Thank you! Never heard of Lürzers.

First time I can see ff Absara used on ad. On the “Pocket pool”, is the body text set with Absara as well?

Dujnoyl, me too, I’d love to get some mid-res samples of these pix.

Thanks,

Xavier

Stephen - Luerzers is new to me too. My girlfriend bought me a copy and I must say I will be buying it in the future. Love the international perspective.  
 [http://www.luerzersarchive.us/products.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155320/http:/www.luerzersarchive.us/products.asp "http://www.luerzersarchive.us/products.asp")?

Xa - the body text on the “Pocket Pool” ad is a sans serif, I’m not sure what, although the type gurus on this site would know instantly. Here’s a pic of that particular ad.

Thanks again everybody. :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155320im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pocket_pool_3666.jpg)

Looks like [Akzidenz Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155320/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Akzidenz%252BGrotesk) for the body copy and [FF Meta](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155320/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FF%252BMeta) for the Lürzer’s footer.
